business.headline: Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.
Sensex down nearly 900 points, investors lose over Rs 4 lakh croreStock market turmoil: At 11:27 am, the Sensex was down 883.93 points to 81,317.23, while the Nifty50 fell 255.95 points to 24,889.15.

Rekha Jhunjhunwala-backed Baazar Style Retail lists a flat on Dalal Street Baazar Style Retail listing: Baazar Style Retail's IPO received strong interest from investors, with an overall subscription of nearly 41 times by the time it closed.

Government starts selling onions at Rs 35/kg in Delhi and Mumbai. Check details The National Cooperative Consumer's Federation (NCCF) and the National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation have started selling onions at Rs 35 per kilogram through special vans in Delhi and Mumbai.

PM asks Singapore business leaders to look for investment opportunities in IndiaDuring the interaction, PM Modi said India had made transformative progress in the last 10 years and would continue on the same path given its strengths of political stability, policy predictability, ease of doing business, and its reform-oriented economic agenda.
NRIs face double tax if they miss filing this form. Check detailsNRIs may face double taxation on the same income if their claim for tax relief under DTAA is denied.

Bizarre IPOs of 2024: SME listings that no one saw comingWhile mainboard IPOs are the ones which attract the big bucks, the trend this year has been different with retail inventors breaking their banks for SME IPOs in a bizarre phenomenon.

Rapido becomes India's latest unicorn with $1.1 billion valuation The latest funding round saw participation from investors including WestBridge Capital, Think Investments and Invus Opportunities, alongside existing investor Nexus Ventures.

Ola Electric shares jump 5% today. Will the rally continue?Ola Electric share price: Brokerage firm Anand Rathi has said that the stock looks "oversold" and that it has great potential.

RIL board set to approve 1st bonus issue since 2017 today. Check detailsThe oil-to-telecom giant, led by Mukesh Ambani, is expected to propose a 1:1 bonus share issue, where investors will receive one bonus share for each share they own.

Shree Tirupati Balajee IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe?Shree Tirupati Balajee's IPO is a book-built issue comprising a fresh issue of 1.48 crore shares totalling Rs 122.43 crore and an offer for sale of 57 lakh shares amounting to Rs 47.23 crore.

GST Council may reduce tax rates on life, health insurance premiums: ReportThe GST Council is expected to review recommendations from the fitment panel, which has been examining the 18% GST rate on health and life insurance products.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Parliament panel may summon Sebi chief, hold review of regulatory bodies: SourcesThe development comes at a time when the Congress has accused Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch of holding an office of profit at ICICI - a charge denied by the bank.

Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang Punia to join Congress today ahead of Haryana electionThe development comes mere days after the two wrestlers met with the party's leader, Rahul Gandhi, in New Delhi on September 4.

Her dreams brutally killed: Kolkata doctor's mother writes note on Teachers' DayIn an open letter, the mother of the RG Kar Hospital victim thanked all the teachers for helping her daughter achieve her dream of becoming a doctor.
Why extended monsoon season is a threat for the Indian farmerThe monsoon, it seems, has lost its rhythm, extending its stay well beyond its traditional September farewell.
Fall of Shivaji statue or collapse of political morality, which shall we mourn more?Elections in Maharashtra are only months away and the politicisation of the issue is inevitable.

Chennai school faces backlash over speaker's rebirth lecture, MK Stalin reacts A spiritual speaker was invited to deliver a motivational talk to students but instead focused on spiritual themes like rebirth, karma, and sin. He also got into an argument with a staff member who objected to his speech, a video of which is viral.

Sunita Williams closes Starliner's hatch to send it home empty Williams and Wilmore removed Starliner's crew seats to optimize space for cargo storage. This modification allows for more efficient packing of materials destined for return to Earth.

ED raids relative of ex-RG Kar principal, 2 other locations in BengalOne of the locations the Enforcement Directorate was raiding in Hooghly included the premises of a relative of Dr Sandip Ghosh, the former principal of RG Kar Medical Centre and Hospital, according to sources.

'Call Me Bae' Review: Glitzy, desi Emily looking for purposeReleased-Fri Sep 06, 2024Ananya Panday-starrer 'Call Me Bae', which also marks her series debut, is now streaming on Prime Video. Deliberating on whether to watch it? Read the review first.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Crew member dies after 30-foot fall at Kannada film set, case against directorThe victim suffered severe injuries from the fall and was taken to the Goraguntepalya Hospital in Bengaluru where, despite the treatment, he succumbed to his injuries on Thursday.

Bihar hospital, awaiting inauguration for 10 years, becomes haven for thievesA government hospital in Bihar, built at a cost of Rs 5 crore and equipped with modern facilities, has become a derelict structure abandoned for almost 10 years even without an inauguration.

Another wolf attack in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, 10-year-old boy injuredA fresh wolf attack occurred in Bahraich, Uttar Pradesh, on Thursday night, in which a 10-year-old boy sustained facial injuries.

Telegram founder Pavel Durov calls his arrest misguided, lists reasons why it was surprisingIn his first public comment after the arrest last month, Pavel Durov slammed his arrest, calling it misguided. He added that Telegram takes down millions of harmful posts every day.

He is the only Indian celebrity to be included on the list.

'Stree 2' box office Day 22: 2nd fastest Rs 500 crore grosser, to beat 'Gadar 2''Stree 2' has become the second fastest Rs 500 crore grosser in Hindi. The film is expected to break the record of 'Gadar 2' by the end of the current weekend at the domestic box office.

sports.headline: Duleep Trophy: Anantapur stadium packed, Chinnaswamy stands in Bengaluru emptyDuleep Trophy: Huge crowd turned up at the Anantapur stadium in Andhra Pradesh for India C vs India D match. Meanwhile, the stands at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru were empty.

Vikram Rathour, Rangana Herath to help New Zealand prepare for Test season in Asia New Zealand Cricket have onboarded Vikram Rathour and Rangana Herath to help them prepare for the upcoming Test season in Asia.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
